data.title: Center for Environmental Management of Military Lands (CEMML)
data.meta_description:
Center for Environmental Management of Military Lands (CEMML) | 1,110 followers on LinkedIn. Supporting military readiness and resource conservation for the Department of Defense and other federal agencies.
 | The Center for Environmental Management of Military Lands (CEMML) is a service, education, and research unit in Colorado State University's Warner College of Natural Resources. CEMML has supported military readiness and resource conservation on public lands since 1985. Working primarily with the Department of Defense, as well as other federal agencies, its multidisciplinary team of natural, physical and social scientists provides expertise in a wide range  of environmental services including natural and cultural resources management, environmental planning and compliance, integrated training area management, geographic information systems, and spatial analysis.
data.text:
CEMML is seeking a #entrylevel #TSCAEnvironmentalComplianceSpecialist position to be based in #hawaii . $55,000 to $65,000 per year + excellent paid leave (24 Days of #annualleave & 11 paid holidays!), medical/dental, and retirement benefits as an employee of Colorado State University. ðŸ˜² Did you know that CSU contributes the equivalent of 12% of your salary toward your 401K retirement account? A Toxic Substance Control Act (TSCA) Environmental Compliance Specialist position is available with the Center for Environmental Management of Military Lands. The position is located at Schofield Barracks, Hawaii. MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: âœ…A BS or BA degree, or equivalent experience. âœ…Work experience in asbestos and/or lead based paint management. âœ…Must have or be able to obtain valid and current certification with the State of Hawaii in the following disciplines: Asbestos Inspector, Asbestos Management Planner, Asbestos NFE/Supervisor, Lead Based Paint Inspector Lead Based Paint Risk Assessor âœ…Must have or be able to obtain medical clearance to wear a respirator. âœ…Must have a valid driverâ€™s license or the ability to obtain a driverâ€™s license by the employment start date. âœ…The successful candidate must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. by proposed start date; CEMML will not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Apply by August 26th for full consideration. See site below for all application details. #hawaiijobs #compliance https://lnkd.in/g3gmbtry

CEMML is seeking a #entrylevel #BiosecurityFieldCrewSupervisor position to be based in #guam . $65,000 - $75,000 per year + excellent paid leave (24 Days of hashtag #annualleave & 11 paid holidays!), medical/dental, and retirement benefits as an employee of @Colorado State University. ðŸ˜² Did you know that CSU contributes the equivalent of 12% of your salary toward your 401K retirement account? The Field Crew Supervisor will be responsible for directing and leading a crew of at least nine (9) biological technicians in conducting invasive species surveys, control and interdiction, operating toxicant bait stations for brown treesnake control, inspecting/maintaining multispecies exclusionary fencing, conducting QA/QC biosecurity inspections of all incoming and outgoing military cargo during military training exercises, and other duties in compliance with the statement of work. Additionally, the Field Crew Supervisor will be responsible for directing and leading 4 non-student hourly Vegetation Management Technicians in a variety of vegetation management tasks. To accomplish these duties, the Field Crew Supervisor will maintain close liaisons with Navy project sponsors and other DoD personnel. MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: âœ…A minimum of a high school diploma, GED, or equivalent. âœ…Two years professional work experience working on natural resource and/or invasive species projects. âœ…Professional experience supervising and managing field crews. Supervisory experience must include scheduling, training, and evaluating staff. âœ…Experienced in conducting field work. âœ…Experienced in collecting, recording, and proofing (QA/QC) data. âœ…Experienced in maintaining scientific records and summarizing observations in reports, brief summaries, and graphics. âœ…Demonstrated experience using and troubleshooting field data collection applications, compasses, maps, data tablet computers, smartphones, and GPS/GNSS units. âœ…Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access). âœ…Ability to obtain any and all local and federal permits required to conduct services, as required for each required task under the Agreement. âœ…Must have a valid driverâ€™s license. âœ…Must be willing to submit for NACI background check to obtain a DoD Defense Biometric Identification System (DBIDS) card. âœ…Must be able to work in a culturally diverse office âœ…The successful candidate must be legally authorized to work in the United States by the proposed start date. âœ…Must be able to deploy from Guam to locations in the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI). âœ…Must be capable of walking several consecutive miles carrying gear of up to 30 pounds and performing light manual labor in a hot tropical environment. âœ…Must be able to take photographs and collect samples Apply by August 19th for full consideration. See site below for all application details. #guamjobs #biosecurity https://lnkd.in/ghA9QSqd

CEMML is seeking a #entrylevel #Archaeologist position to be based in #southcarolina . $48,000 - $53,000 per year + excellent paid leave (24 Days of #annualleave & 11 paid holidays!), medical/dental, and retirement benefits as an employee of @Colorado State University. ðŸ˜² Did you know that CSU contributes the equivalent of 12% of your salary toward your 401K retirement account? An Archaeologist position is available with the Center for Environmental Management Military Lands to provide on-site support for the Cultural Resources Management Program at Edwards Air Force Base (EAFB). Primary tasks include data and document collection and synthesis, data entry, field verification, GIS attribution, site record updates, and report preparation. This position requires excellent skills in observation, documentation, and reporting; a positive attitude; strong work ethic; commitment to quality and safety; and experience collating, tracking, reviewing, and commenting on field reports conducted by others. MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: âœ…Bachelorâ€™s degree in #Archaeology, #Anthropology, or closely related field. âœ…Candidates must also have a minimum of 3 years of professional/post-graduate field experience. âœ…Thorough knowledge of the fundamental principles and theories of professional archeology. Resume should demonstrate a combination of post-graduate professional knowledge and field experience regarding application of laws and regulations, field techniques, and survey/investigation processes and procedures. âœ…Demonstrated experience identifying artifacts and cultural features in the field. âœ…Proficient with all aspects of archaeological research and reporting, including research design, mitigation plans, fieldwork, and report writing. âœ…Have a thorough understanding of most standard computer programs, especially MS Windows OS and Office software including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook. âœ…Previous work experience in a highly structured, hierarchical workplace with a well-defined chain-of-command. âœ…Must be in good physical condition, and capable of walking several consecutive miles while carrying gear of up to 25 pounds in a hot desert environment on uneven terrain. âœ…Must have a valid driverâ€™s license or the ability to obtain a driverâ€™s license by the employment start date. âœ…The successful candidate must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. by proposed start date; CEMML will not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Apply by August 19th for full consideration. See site below for all application details. #californiajobs https://lnkd.in/gvbj_ueT

CEMML is seeking a #entrylevel #HeavyEquipmentOperator position to be based in #southcarolina . $48,000 - $53,000 per year + excellent paid leave (24 Days of #annualleave & 11 paid holidays!), medical/dental, and retirement benefits as an employee of Colorado State University. ðŸ˜² Did you know that CSU contributes the equivalent of 12% of your salary toward your 401K retirement account? Operate heavy equipment such as: 10 to 25 ton dump trucks, dozers, motor graders, front-in loaders, vibratory compactors, scrapers, forestry mowers (FECON), track hoes, agricultural tractors, and back hoes for the purpose of completing Land Rehabilitation and Maintenance (LRAM) projects. Primary functions are soil stabilization and vegetation management on Army lands. This position will also require tracking and preparing monthly and quarterly reports. MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: âœ…2 years professional experience. âœ…A High school Diploma, General Education Development (GED), or equivalent. âœ…Experience with running and maintaining heavy equipment. âœ…Physically able to work outdoors and perform strenuous labor under all weather conditions (e.g., heat and humidity). Able to lift 40 pounds repeatedly. âœ…Be able to follow directions, work collectively with others as a team, and maintain safe working standards. âœ…The successful candidate must reside in the Installation vicinity; telecommuting is not available for this position. âœ…Must have a valid and current driverâ€™s license. âœ…The successful candidate must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. by proposed start date; CEMML will not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Apply by August 19th for full consideration. See site below for all application details. #southcarolinajobs #operator https://lnkd.in/guxu4H2v

CEMML is seeking a #midlevel #ClimatePolicyAnalyst position to be based in #virginia . $95,000 - $110,000 per year + excellent paid leave (24 Days of #annualleave & 11 paid holidays!), medical/dental, and retirement benefits as an employee of Colorado State University. ðŸ˜² Did you know that CSU contributes the equivalent of 12% of your salary toward your 401K retirement account? This position will develop briefings for Army and Department of Defense officials, respond to Congressional inquiries, and contribute to scenario planning. Analysis of large data sets across multiple regions and climates to develop climate change projections to assess impact to training and training support efforts, will also be required. Travel and attendance to associated climate symposia, working groups, and in progress reviews will be required. Travel may be required overseas. Travel may be up to 10% of this position. MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: âœ…Bachelorâ€™s degree in climate science, climate adaptation, ecosystem management, ecology, natural/environmental sciences, environmental policy, urban planning, engineering or closely related field AND a minimum of five yearsâ€™ experience providing support to either Headquarter-level programs, or five yearsâ€™ experience with military training lands and ranges or installation environmental programs, OR âœ…Masterâ€™s degree in climate science, climate adaptation, ecosystem management, ecology, natural/environmental sciences, environmental policy, urban planning, engineering or closely related AND a minimum of two yearsâ€™ experience providing support to Headquarter-level programs or two years with military training lands and ranges or installation environmental programs. âœ…Experience in communicating environmental/climate policy and regulations to diverse audiences. âœ…Ability to analyze and apply complex scientific findings to real world implications. âœ…Current secret security clearance or ability to obtain required secret clearance. âœ…Must have a valid driverâ€™s license or the ability to obtain a driverâ€™s license by the employment start date. âœ…The successful candidate must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. by proposed start date; CEMML will not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Apply by August 19th for full consideration. See site below for all application details. #virginiajobs #climatechange https://lnkd.in/gyC6HQ7F

CEMML is seeking an #entrylevel #NaturalResourcesTechnician based in #southcarolina. $38,000 - $40,000 salary (Prorated for positions lasting less than 1 year) and benefits as an employee of Colorado State University. Looking to fill position in Fall, 2024. This position is part of the Early Career Development Program with CEMML (#ECDP_CEMML), providing real world experience to help jumpstart your career in natural and cultural resources. POSITION SUMMARY: The Natural Resource Technician will provide support to the Shaw AFB Natural Resource Managers on a variety of forest and habitat management projects, including habitat for the federally listed red-cockaded woodpecker (RCW). Technicians will also take part in assisting with herpetology and other avian species surveys, developing maps using ArcGIS, and will have opportunities to get involved with the Shaw AFB cultural resources and wetland management programs. Once hired, technicians will be given the necessary safety training and certifications for operating heavy equipment such as tractors. Most of the work will be conducted outdoors and will entail working either alongside other technicians/managers and/or independently, as necessary. The many tasks and projects associated with this position will provide excellent experience to anyone interested in a career in wildlife or related natural resources management. Hiring preference will be given to those already residing in South Carolina. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. For all information related to this posting go to the link below. https://lnkd.in/gsPrKWSy

CEMML is seeking an #entrylevel #GISTechnician based in #colorado. $41,000 - $45,000 salary (Prorated for positions lasting less than 1 year) and benefits as an employee of Colorado State University. Looking to fill position in Fall, 2024. This position is part of the Early Career Development Program with CEMML (#ECDP_CEMML), providing real world experience to help jumpstart your career in natural and cultural resources. POSITION SUMMARY: The GIS Technician will provide support to the Vegetation Mapping and Wetland Delineation teams. The primary tasks include digitizing aerial imagery, creating maps and plant identification guides, looking for plant communities within the National Vegetation Classification system and data entry. There is also potential to assist teams with field work if needed. This position is in-person and preference will be given to those already residing in the state. Must be able to relocate with vehicle. ECDP is currently unable to provide relocation or housing costs or recommendations. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. For all information related to this posting go to the link below. https://lnkd.in/gvYsDcdK

CEMML is seeking a #midlevel #NaturalResourcesPlanningSpecialist position to be based in #colorado . $58,000-63,000 per year + excellent paid leave (24 Days of #annualleave & 11 paid holidays!), medical/dental, and retirement benefits as an employee of Colorado State University. ðŸ˜² Did you know that CSU contributes the equivalent of 12% of your salary toward your 401K retirement account? The Natural Resources Planning Specialist will provide technical assistance for the development and review of regulatory compliance documents, including Integrated Natural Resources Management Plans (INRMPs), National Environmental Policy Act analyses, wetland reports, biological assessments, fieldwork reports, and other natural resources-related documents. A main component of this position is to collaborate with Air Force natural resource managers for continual maintenance and improvements to INRMPs. Therefore, an understanding of natural resource management on military lands is required. An additional focus will be to review regulation-reporting documents, natural resources studies and surveys, and climate change reports and integrate relevant information into INRMPs. As such, excellent scientific synthesis, writing, and communication skills are required. The Specialist also will assist Subject Matter Experts with researching and compiling information for the review of goals, objectives, and projects in INRMPs and collaboratively develop recommendations that are both scientifically sound and guided by a regulatory or mission driver. The Specialist will assist with all facets of document production (e.g., writing, editing, formatting).. MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: âœ…M.S. in #EnvironmentalPolicy, #Ecology, #Biology, or a different natural resources-related field OR a B.S. in one of those fields plus at least three years of professional experience. âœ…Experience preparing or reviewing compliance documents (e.g., Sikes Act, Clean Water Act, National Environmental Policy Act, Endangered Species Act). âœ…Experience preparing or reviewing natural resources planning documents. âœ…Knowledge of natural resource-related Department of Defense Instructions (DoDI) and Air Force Manuals (AFMAN) (e.g. DoDI 4715.03, AFMAN 32-7003). âœ…Demonstrated knowledge of natural resource-related topics (e.g., hydrology, ecology, geology) âœ…Experience summarizing scientific information for clients and/or the public. âœ…Excellent writing and editing skills. âœ…Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat Pro. âœ…Proficiency with ArcGIS. âœ…Must have a valid driverâ€™s license or the ability to obtain a driverâ€™s license by the employment start date. âœ…The successful candidate must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. by the proposed start date; CEMML will not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Apply by August 19th for full consideration. See site below for all application details. #coloradojobs #naturalresources https://lnkd.in/gRJ4_gRi

CEMML is seeking multiple #midlevel #HazardousWasteSpecialist positions to be based in #hawaii . $80,000 - $86,000 per year + excellent paid leave (24 Days of #annualleave & 11 paid holidays!), medical/dental, and retirement benefits as an employee of Colorado State University. ðŸ˜² Did you know that CSU contributes the equivalent of 12% of your salary toward your 401K retirement account? This position will provide technical support to Naval Facilities Engineering Command (NAVFAC) Hawaiiâ€™s Environmental compliance branch ensuring compliance to all regulatory requirements of the Hazardous Waste and Munitions/Ordnance compliance programs. The candidate will provide technical oversight and subject matter expertise in support of a variety of projects including Hazardous Waste, Pollution Prevention, Munitions Support, Hazardous Materials Management, Project Reviews, and the Environmental Management System (EMS). The overall goal of this support is to identify ways to improve processes and minimize waste streams while ensuring compliance with local and federal regulations. MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: âœ…A bachelorâ€™s degree with 3 years of professional, post-baccalaureate experience. âœ…A minimum of 3 years of experience in Hazardous Waste Program Support. âœ…Demonstrated work experience with Environmental Compliance Programs (pollution prevention, hazardous waste, munitions/ordinance disposal). âœ…Other required qualifications are the ability to work independently, take initiative to resolve issues, and demonstrate superior verbal and written communication skills. âœ…Must be able to pass the DoD background check for a Common Access Card (CAC). âœ…Must have a valid driverâ€™s license or the ability to obtain a driverâ€™s license by the employment start date. âœ…The successful candidate must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. by proposed start date; CEMML will not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Apply by August 19th for full consideration. See site below for all application details. hashtag #hawaiijobs #waste #specialist https://lnkd.in/gRffNge2

CEMML is seeking multiple #entrylevel #BotanicalTechnician positions to be based in #hawaii . $40,000 - $43,000 per year + excellent paid leave (24 Days of #annualleave & 11 paid holidays!), medical/dental, and retirement benefits as an employee of Colorado State University. ðŸ˜² Did you know that CSU contributes the equivalent of 12% of your salary toward your 401K retirement account? A Botanical Technician position is available with the Center for Environmental Management of Military Lands (CEMML). This position is located at Pohakuloa Training Area on the Big Island of Hawaii. The work site is located about 45 minutes from Hilo and Kona. The terrain is very rugged, consisting of extensive lava flows intermixed with vegetated areas. The elevation is about 7,000 feet and the climate is relatively cool and varies from wet to dry. The Botanical Technician supports management of native and non-native plant species. Management includes surveying and monitoring federally listed plant species and their habitats, native plant seed collection and outplanting. Invasive species management includes field survey plus chemical and mechanical control of target invasive species. The technician collects data and provides written and oral reports. The technician primarily works as part of a field crew, but also works alone. The position is primarily field work (90%) with about 10% office time. MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: âœ…BS/BA in #botany, #naturalresourcemanagement, #environmentalscience, or closely related natural science or two years of work experience in these areas can be substituted for the educational requirement. âœ…Experience with monitoring and/or managing plant species. âœ…Demonstrated experience working in remote field locations; ability to walk up to 5 miles per day in rugged terrain carrying materials and supplies under all weather conditions. âœ…Working knowledge of computers and Microsoft Office Suite. âœ…Must have a valid driverâ€™s license or the ability to obtain a driverâ€™s license by the employment start date. âœ…The successful candidate must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. by proposed start date; CEMML will not provide visa sponsorship for this position. âœ…Have a State of Hawaii Commercial Pesticide Applicator certification or ability to pass applicator exam and obtain within 3 months of employment. âœ…Must maintain Hawaii State Pesticide Applicatorâ€™s certification throughout employment. âœ…Must be able to repetitively lift 50 lbs. Apply by August 19th for full consideration. See site below for all application details. #hawaiijobs #botany https://lnkd.in/g3__Mdkk
